entry.title: How to Enable SR-IOV from the BIOS/UEFI Firmware of Your Motherboard
entry.summary: The full form of SR-IOV is Single Root I/O Virtualization. Some PCI/PCIE devices have multiple virtual functions and each of these virtual functions can be passed to a different virtual machine. SR-IOV is the technology that allows this type of PCI/PCIE passthrough. For example, an 8-port SR-IOV capable network card has 8 virtual functions, 1 […]

entry.title: How to Enable IOMMU/VT-d from the BIOS/UEFI Firmware of Your Motherboard
entry.summary: The full form of IOMMU is Input Output Memory Management Unit. IOMMU maps the virtual addresses of a device to physical addresses which allows the device to be passed to a virtual machine (VM). VT-D does the same thing as IOMMU.
